Sentencas: The high volatility of boron from borosilicate glass sealants often leads to boron deposition and poisoning of La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3 (LSCF) cathode, presenting a challenge for the development of reliable solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Effect of nickel doping on structure and suppressing boron volatility of borosilicate glass sealants in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this paper, we report that boron volatilization from borosilicate glass at 700 degrees C can be significantly suppressed by appropriate NiO dopant, mainly due to the increase of Si-O-B linkages in the combining B-O- and Si-O- network.
Titulo: Effect of nickel doping on structure and suppressing boron volatility of borosilicate glass sealants in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Also, the formation of boron-containing phase in NiO-doping glass-ceramics has been studied, which suppresses the reaction between glass and LSCF cathode after heat treatment at 700 degrees C for 1000 h. Moreover, the change of crystalline phases leads to an improvement in thermal and electrical properties.
Titulo: Effect of nickel doping on structure and suppressing boron volatility of borosilicate glass sealants in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: We believe that our findings will open a new way for the design and development of the reliable sealing glass for SOFCs applications.
Titulo: Effect of nickel doping on structure and suppressing boron volatility of borosilicate glass sealants in solid oxide fuel cells
